intro: Stypandra caespitosa var. alba, commonly known as the white stypandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a perennial herb that forms dense, compact clumps, with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within the Stypandraceae family.
